p: Perhaps, the most apparent and life-changing measure to the general public is the implementation of mitigation strategies, which are non-pharmaceutical interventions for communities with local transmission. These strategies are based on lessons learned from previous pandemics and are interventions that assist in slowing transmission of the virus in communities. This is an especially important feat prior to the wide availability of a pandemic vaccine. These strategies include “personal protective measures for everyday use” like self-isolation and hand hygiene; “personal protective measures reserved for pandemics” like home quarantine and wearing face masks when ill; “community measures aimed at increasing social distancing” like closing schools and stopping mass gatherings; and “environmental measures” like cleaning all surfaces that are frequently touched ( 128). The timing of the implementation of these strategies during the current pandemic has been under scrutiny.
